title: Criticism of the Western Civilization-Collection 66 (WW1, WW2 5)
description:
Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 66 (WW-I, WW-II 5):

We have 34 titles here:

-  Anievas (Ed.) - Cataclysm 1914; the First World War and the Making of Modern World Politics (2015)

-  Bacque - Crimes and Mercies; the Fate of German Civilians under Allied Occupation, 1944-1950 (2007)

-  Calvin - The Failure of Economic Diplomacy; Britain, Germany, France and the Unites States, 1931-36 (1996)

-  Charles River Editors - The Start of World War II; the History of the Events That Culminated with Nazi Germany's Invasion of Poland

-  Dove (Ed.) - 'Totally Un-English'; Britain's Internment of 'Enemy Aliens' in Two World Wars (2005)

-  Epp - Women without Men; Mennonite Refugees of the Second World War (2000)

-  Farmer - Understand the Second World War (2010)

-  Fugita & Fernanzez - Altered Lives, Enduring Community; Japanese Americans Remember Their World War II Incarceration (2004)

-  Gatrell - A Whole Empire Walking; Refugees in Russia During World War I (1999)

-  Gay & Gay - World War I; Voices from the Past (1995)

-  Gilbert - The First World War; a Complete History (2014)

-  Gould - World War I, 1914-1916; a Terrible New Warfare Begins (2014)

-  Kershaw - To Hell and Back; Europe, 1914-1949 (2015)

-  King & Woolmans - The Assassination of the Archduke; Sarajevo 1914 and the Murder That Changed the World (2013)

-  Megargee - War of Annihilation; Combat and Genocide on the Eastern Front, 1941 (2006)

-  Nicholson - Singled Out; How Two Million British Women Survived without Men after the First World War (2008)

-  Nobbs - In Battle & Captivity, 1916-1918; a British Officer's Memoirs of the Trenches and a German Prison Camp (2014)

-  Overy - 1939; Countdown to War (2009)

-  Overy - The Inter-War Crisis, 1919-1939, 2e (2007)

-  Overy - The Origins of the Second World War, 3e (2008)

-  Plokhy - Yalta; the Price of Peace (2010)

-  Rees - Horror in the East; Japan and the Atrocities of World War II (2001)

-  Russell - The Knights of Bushido; a History of Japanese War Crimes During World War II (2008)

-  Snyder - Sex Crimes Under the Wehrmacht (2007)

-  Snyder - The Ideology of the Offensive; Military Decision Making and the Disasters of 1914 (1984)

-  Sollors - The Temptation of Despair; Tales of the 1940s (2014)

-  Stevenson - Cataclysm; the First World War as Political Tragedy (2004)

-  Suleiman - Crises of Memory and the Second World War (2006)

-  Thomas - Unsafe for Democracy; World War I and the U.S. Justice Department's Covert Campaign to Suppress Dissent (2008)

-  Trzcinska-Croydon - The Labyrinth of Dangerous Hours; a Memoir of the Second World War (2004)

-  Wadsworth - Letters from the Trenches; the First World War by Those Who Were There (2014)

-  Williams - Wartime Disasters at Sea; Every Passenger Ship Loss in World Wars I and II (1997)

-  Williams - We're in This Together;  Forty World War II Memories (2012)

-  Williamson - Poland Betrayed; the Nazi-Soviet Invasions of 1939 (2009)
